title: State or Territory Sponsored Investor (subclass 893) visa
summary: This page provides information about the State or Territory Sponsored Investor (subclass 893) visa, which closed to new applications on 22 March 2025. It outlines what the visa allows, how long it lasts, obligations for visa holders, and what changes must be reported to the authorities.

structured_data.visa_name: State or Territory Sponsored Investor visa
structured_data.description: A permanent visa for state or territory sponsored investors, allowing holders to stay indefinitely in Australia.

entitlements: Travel to and from Australia for 5 years from the grant date
Use VEVO for free to check visa details and entitlements

travel_conditions: Unlimited travel to and from Australia for 5 years while travel facility is valid
after_travel_facility_expires: Apply for and be granted a Resident Return visa to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Consider becoming an Australian citizen to avoid needing a visa to re-enter Australia
citizenship_notes: Australian citizens must use an Australian passport when leaving and re-entering Australia
Eligibility requirements and processing times for citizenship apply

rights_for_holder_and_dependents: Carry out business and investment activity in Australia
Enrol in Medicare (Australiaâ€™s public health care scheme)
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible

changes_to_report: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
change_notification_requirements.consequences_of_not_reporting_passport_c: Significant delays at the airport and possible denial of permission to board a plane
